rx.testkit

Class AssertObservable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.core.api.AbstractAssert<AssertObservable<T>,io.reactivex.Observable<T>>
      • rx.testkit.AssertObservable<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.assertj.core.api.Assert<AssertObservable<T>,io.reactivex.Observable<T>>, org.assertj.core.api.Descriptable<AssertObservable<T>>, org.assertj.core.api.ExtensionPoints<AssertObservable<T>,io.reactivex.Observable<T>>

    public class AssertObservable<T>
extends org.assertj.core.api.AbstractAssert<AssertObservable<T>,io.reactivex.Observable<T>>
    AssertJ Assert class for Observable. Uses TestSubscriber from Rx to subscribe to and Observable and perform assertions on the results. Optionally, a TestScheduler can be used to perform async testing.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.assertj.core.api.AbstractAssert

        actual, info, myself

      • after

        public AssertObservable<T> after(long duration,
                                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        If a TestScheduler is provided, advanced the time by the specified duration. Throws an IllegalStateException if there is no TestScheduler provided. Use AssertObservable(Observable, TestScheduler) to construct an AssertObservable instance that can be used for async testing.
        Parameters:
        duration - the time duration
        timeUnit - the time unit of the duration
        Returns:
        the AssertObservableInstance.
